'''Kirlia''' ([[List of Japanese Pokémon names|Japanese]]: '''キルリア''' ''Kirlia'') is a dual-type {{2t|Psychic|Fairy}} {{OBP|Pokémon|species}} introduced in [[Generation III]]. Prior to Generation VI, it was a pure {{type|Psychic}} Pokémon.

It [[Evolution|evolves]] from {{p|Ralts}} starting at [[level]] 20 and evolves into {{p|Gardevoir}} starting at level 30 or, if male, into {{p|Gallade}} when exposed to a [[Dawn Stone]].

==Biology==
Kirlia is a bipedal, humanoid Pokémon that appears to be wearing a tutu. Most of its body is white, and there are three ruffles on each hip. Beneath the ruffles, it has skinny green legs with pointed feet. Its arms are also thin with two digits each. It has green hair that covers most of its face and reaches its shoulders on either side, resembling two {{wp|ponytails}}. Large, red eyes are visible on either side of the hair that covers its face. On each side of its head is a flat, red horn that resembles a hairpin.

Kirlia's horns are used to amplify its psychokinetic power and distort the air around it. The distortion in the air causes scenery mirages and can cause a rip in dimensions. This ability also allows this Pokémon to see into the future. It enjoys dancing on sunny mornings, and grows beautiful when exposed to a {{pkmn|Trainer}} with positive emotions. Kirlia inhabits {{DL|List of Pokémon by habitat|Urban Pokémon|urban areas}}.

==In the anime==
[[File:Zoey Kirlia.png|thumb|200px|left|Kirlia in the {{pkmn|anime}}]]
===Major appearances===
Kirlia debuted in ''[[M06|Jirachi: Wish Maker]]'', under the ownership of [[Butler]]. It was used for a magic act during the [[Millennium Festival]], and later to fight an {{p|Absol}}.

[[Elijah]] used a Kirlia in a movie in ''[[AG086|Lights, Camerupt, Action!]]''. The Emotion Pokémon played the {{wp|damsel in distress}} in the movie, being taken by an {{p|Exploud}} and later rescued by {{p|Plusle}} and {{p|Minun}}.

A {{pkmn2|wild}} Kirlia appeared in ''[[AG109|Do I Hear a Ralts?]]'' along with a Gardevoir. Both of them sent {{TRT}} flying when they cornered [[Max]] and {{AP|Snorunt}} while they were hurrying to send Ralts to the [[Pokémon Center]]. However, Kirlia and Gardevoir thought that Max was also trying to steal Ralts. When Ralts blocked Kirlia and Gardevoir's {{m|Psychic}}, all hostilities were ignored and the two Pokémon left. Kirlia and Gardevoir appeared once more at the near-end of the episode to send [[James]] flying as Ralts had already launched [[Jessie]] and {{MTR}} for posing as Gardevoir and Kirlia.

A Kirlia appeared in ''[[AG146|Fear Factor Phony]]'', where it was living in an abandoned mining colony. [[Jessie's Wobbuffet]] fell in love with the Emotion Pokémon.

Two Kirlia appeared in ''[[DP020|Mutiny in the Bounty!]]''. One appeared in a flashback, being one of [[Pokémon poacher|Pokémon Hunter]] [[J]]'s stolen Pokémon. The other was used by [[Melodi]] so Ash and {{ashfr}} could find out where J and [[J's henchmen|her minions]] will strike next, after [[Ash's Pikachu]], Melodi's Gardevoir, and Team Rocket's Meowth were all stolen.

[[Zoey]] was revealed to have obtained a Kirlia in ''[[DP155|Double-Time Battle Training!]]''. She used him, along with her {{p|Leafeon}}, in a [[Double Battle]] against [[Dawn's Cyndaquil]] and {{TP|Dawn|Mamoswine}}. He was later shown to have evolved into Gallade in ''[[DP177|A Grand Fight for Winning!]]''.

===Minor appearances===
A {{pkmn|Coordinator}}'s Kirlia appeared in a flashback in ''[[AG060|Delcatty Got Your Tongue]]''. It was defeated by [[Dr. Abby]]'s {{p|Skitty}} during the [[Contest Battle|Battle Stage]] of the [[Grand Festival]].

A Kirlia appeared in ''[[M10|The Rise of Darkrai]]'' as one of the Pokémon attacked by {{OBP|Darkrai|M10}} and having nightmares. [[Alicia]], [[Alice]]'s grandmother, treated Kirlia and woke it up, along with {{p|Roserade}} and {{p|Luxray}}.

A Kirlia appeared in ''[[M16|Genesect and the Legend Awakened]]'' at [[Pokémon Hills]].

A Kirlia appeared in ''[[XY002|Lumiose City Pursuit!]]''.

A Kirlia appeared in ''[[XY008|Grooming Furfrou!]]''

A Kirlia appeared in ''[[XY026|A Battle by Any Other Name!]]''.

A Kirlia appeared in [[SS027]].

A {{pkmn|Performer}}'s Kirlia appeared in ''[[XY060|A Showcase Debut!]]'', where it was seen participating in the [[Coumarine City]] [[Pokémon Showcase]].

Two Kirlia appeared in ''[[XY092|Cloudy Fate, Bright Future!]]''. One was under the ownership of a {{tc|Psychic}}, while the other was owned by a Trainer.

A Kirlia appeared in ''[[XY105|Party Dancecapades!]]'', under the ownership of a Performer attending [[Monsieur Pierre]]'s dance party.

A Kirlia appeared in ''[[M19|Volcanion and the Mechanical Marvel]]'' as one of the Pokémon seen at [[Nebel Plateau]].

===In the Pokémon Adventures manga===
{{main|Rara}}
{{adv|Ruby}} has a {{p|Ralts}} which evolved into a Kirlia, nicknamed Rara. While he was with {{adv|Wally}}, Wally wound up keeping Rara (then still a Ralts) after an earthquake separated Ruby and Wally. In ''[[PS241|Prior to Rayquaza Redemption I]]'' she evolved into Kirlia. Rara was returned to Ruby when he met up with Wally again. In the ''[[Omega Ruby & Alpha Sapphire chapter (Adventures)|Omega Ruby & Alpha Sapphire chapter]]'', Rara evolved into a {{p|Gardevoir}} while under {{adv|Sapphire}}'s training.

In ''[[PAORAS00|Omega Alpha Adventure 0]]'', {{adv|Sapphire}} is revealed to have obtained a male Kirlia, nicknamed Kirly. In the same chapter, Kirly evolved into {{p|Gallade}} when Sapphire accidentally unearthed a [[Dawn Stone]] and kicked it towards him.

===In the Pokémon Diamond and Pearl Adventure! manga===
A {{tc|Battle Girl}} used a Kirlia against [[Hareta]] in ''[[DPA25|Clash! Hareta vs. Koya]]''.

==Trivia==
* Kirlia shares its {{pkmn|category}} with {{p|Mesprit}}. They are both known as Emotion Pokémon.
* Kirlia's number in the [[List of Pokémon by Sinnoh Pokédex number|Sinnoh Pokédex]] ({{v2|Platinum}} only) and the [[List of Pokémon by Almia Browser number|Almia Browser]] are the same: 158.

===Origin===
Kirlia resembles a {{wp|ballerina}}.

====Name origin====
Kirlia is derived from ''{{wp|Kirlian photography}}'', a special way of taking pictures that supposedly reveals psychic energy auras around subjects.
